text: Practice Problems 4 November 20, 2023 1. Prove that if a ≡ b (m) and c ≡ d (m), then ac ≡ bd (m). 2. Prove with an example for modulus 10 that ab ≡ ac (m) and a ̸≡ 0 (m) do not together imply b ≡ c (m). 3. What values of x satisfy 2x ≡ 4 (7). 4. Find the least positive residue of 1492 mod 4, mod 10 and mod 101. 5. Find all m such that 1848 ≡ 1914 mod m. 6. Show that every odd prime number is congruent to 1 or 3 modulo 4. 7. Show that for k ≥ 0 and m ≥ 1, x ≡ 1 mod mk implies xm ≡ 1 mod (mk+1). 8. Solve the linear equation 9x + 10y = 11 for integer solutions. 9. What possibilities are there for the number of solutions of a linear congruence modulo 20? 10. When the marchers in the School Parade lined up 4 in a row, there was one person left out. When they tried ﬁve in a row, there were two left out and lining up 7 in a row left three out. How many members are there in the school parade? 11. Calculate 22 and 220 modulo 11. 12. What is the least residue of (1945)8 modulo 7? 13. Show that 2(p − 3)! + 1 ≡ 0 mod p for a prime number p. 14. Show that the converse of Fermat’s Little theorem is false. 15. If n is a square, show that τ (n) is odd. 16. If f is a multiplicative function is g(n) := f (n)/n multiplicative? 1 17. Show that a6 ≡ 1 (14) for all a such that (a, 14) = 1. 18. Calculate a8 mod 15 for a = 1, 3, · · · 14. 19. If (a, m) = 1, show that any x such that x ≡ ca ϕ(m)−1 mod m satisﬁes ax ≡ c mod m. 20. Show that ϕ(n) = n/2 ⇔ n = 2k for some positive integer k. 21. Say that n is superperfect if σ(σ(n)) = 2n. Show that if n = 2k and (2k+1 − 1) is prime, then n is superperfect. 2
